subject: Technology
title: The Boy Who Invented Television
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Boy Who Invented Television.

hook.text: A 14-year-old farm boy plowing a field imagined scanning images in rows, like a plow. He invented electronic television.

buildup.text: Philo Farnsworth saw how a plow cuts a field line by line. He realized you could scan an image the same way.

discovery.text: By age 21, Farnsworth demonstrated the first fully electronic television system. He transmitted a simple line on screen.

twist.text: RCA's David Sarnoff stole the idea through patent wars. Farnsworth won in court but was financially ruined by the fight.

climax.text: Farnsworth died in obscurity. Most history books credit others. The farm boy who invented TV was largely forgotten.

punchline.text: A teenager invented television. A corporation took the credit.

quiz.question: What inspired Philo Farnsworth's idea for electronic television?
options: Plowing a field in rows on his family's farm
